CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper December 22, 1951, pg. 1, reads: "Merry Christmas! - The Christmas season is at hand and in city, town and country, throughout the length and breadth of the Christian world, there will be many scenes like this one unconsciously staged by children of both races who stopped in the snow to gaze in awe at the Christmas tree put up in the vicinity of the Prince Hall Masons' Lodge Hall on Larimer Avenue. It is cold in the snow, but it would indeed be wonderful if the warmth for all mankind that abounds in children's hearts at this season of the year could be transferred on a year-round basis to adult hearts, or be carried into their homes and businesses so that the 'Peace on Earth, to Men of Goodwill' of which the angels sang on Christ's birthday might become a mode of life for all. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Children gathered around snow-covered Christmas tree in front of brick building, Larimer
